comments:
Hi,

I have installed Eclipse (eclipse-SDK-3.1M6-win32.zip) with the EMF, GEF, JEF
and WTP added on. However, the program does not start and give an error as below.

Thanks for any help...

java.version=1.5.0-beta
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.

Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

please check your JDK level and try the latest eclipse build. (RC4) 

moving to runtime to double check...

Eclipse does not work with AElfred2 SAX parser implementation, which you
probably have installed under your <JRE_HOME>/lib/ext directory. Eclipse will
run with 1.4/1.5 JRE built-in parser. See bug 69125 for another case.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 57298 ***

Hi,

I don't have AElfred2 SAX parser in the JRE folder. I have xercesImpl.jar. When
I try to delete this it says "it is being used by another process".

My JRE is 1.5.0 and I have downloaded "eclipse-SDK-3.1RC4-win32.zip". Still the
same problem.

I couldn't really understand what I should do regarding the #57298.

Thanks

Do you have any third-party plug-ins are you running a fresh Eclipse install?
The Eclipse SDK does not contain the Aelfred  parser, so it must be coming from
elsewhere, and the extension classpath is the likely source.

I was using a previous version (3.1 something) of Eclipse before. Yesterday I
have uninstalled it and install the new version. However, the program does not
start now.

I haven't used any plug-in additions for Eclipse. But I have added the xerces
relates files to the JRE/lib/ext directory. Do I have to delete those?

You can use jar.exe to list the contents of every JAR in the lib/ext dir to find
out which one contains the gnu.xml.aelfred2 package:

<JAVA_HOME>\bin\jar.exe tf <JAR file>

Hi Rafael,

I realised that I have a jar named "gnujaxp.jar" in \...\Java\j2re1.5.0\lib\ext
and you are right that it contains a folder called aelfred2. I have deleted this
and Eclipse starts now without any problem.

Thanks for your help.
